defaultPosition.description:
Serves as a Safety and Occupational Health Specialist on the staff of the ICE Headquarters Safety Department, conducts inspections nationwide in a variety of industrial, commercial, and business establishments that are privately and agency owned which perform law enforcement and support operations.  Determines compliance with published standards, citations for violations, proposes risk assessment codes, and provides technical assistance to multiple levels of management and employees to achieve safe working environments.  Answers safety questions and gives safety advice to different ICE facilities throughout the nation during the year.
Plans, schedules and conducts inspections of establishments and work sites characterized by sensitive labor-management relations requiring the use of persuasion to obtain the cooperation of both parties within regions where there is a strong probability of encountering hazardous work processes and materials, and unsafe environmental conditions, involving substantial numbers of employees.  Immediately obtains corrective action of conditions when there are acts of imminent danger to life or limb.
Conducts announced and sometimes unannounced visits to work places previously inspected by Federal compliance inspectors to determine whether or not the Safety program is as effective as the Federal compliance program in the identification and resolution of hazards. 
Performs Annual Workplace Inspections of private and agency owned establishments and inspects work area based on complaints received from employees and union representatives alleging failure by agency to enforce safety and occupational health standards and submits comprehensive reports on findings to safety and occupational health management.
Reports to appropriate managing entities all findings that are outside of the health and safety realm, such as environmental findings to ICE environmental or security findings to the facilities security.
